Object markers and delineators should not present a vertical or horizontal clearance obstacle for pedestrians.

page.title:
Colors
Colors
page.enlisting:
Pavement markings shall be yellow, white, or red. Black is permitted in combination with the above colors.
Pavement markings
shall be yellow, white,
or red.
Black is permitted in
combination with the
above colors.

Markings shall be yellow, white, red, or blue. Black in conjunction with one of the above colors shall be a usable color for object markers.
Markings shall be yellow,
white, red, or blue.
Black in conjunction
with one of the above
colors shall be a usable
color for object markers.

page.normal_text:
A dotted line is used to delineate a line extension...shall be the same color as the line it extends.
A dotted line is used to
delineate a line
extension...shall be the
same color as the line it
extends.

the width shall be at least the same as the width of the line it extends.

least the same as the
width of the line it
extends.

page.title:
Widths & Patterns of Longitudinal Line Markings
Widths & Patterns of
Longitudinal Line Markings
page.normal_text:
Sections 3A-6, Paragraph 5: A doted line(s) is formed by short segments, normally two feet in length, and gaps, normally four feet or longer.
Sections 3A-6, Paragraph 5:
A doted line(s) is formed by
short segments, normally
two feet in length, and gaps,
normally four feet or longer.

Option: A dotted line may consist of 0.6 m (2 ft) line segments, and 1.2 m (4 ft) or longer gaps with a maximum segment-to-gap ratio of 1-to-3.
Option: A dotted line
may consist of 0.6 m (2
ft) line segments, and 1.2
m (4 ft) or longer gaps
with a maximum
segment-to-gap ratio of
1-to-3.

page.title:
Center Line Markings
Center Line Markings
page.normal_text:
1988 MUTCD A center line separates traffic traveling in opposite directions.
1988 MUTCD
A center line separates
traffic traveling in
opposite directions.

Centerline pavement markings, when used, shall be the pavement markings used to delineate the separation of traffic lanes that have opposite directions of travel on a roadway and shall be yellow.
Centerline pavement
markings, when used, shall
be the pavement markings
used to delineate the
separation of traffic lanes
that have opposite directions
of travel on a roadway and
shall be yellow. s h a l l
b e
y e l l o w .

MUTCD PART III. MARKINGS
MUTCD PART III. MARKINGS

page.title:
Markings on Four-or-More Lane, Two-Way Roadways
Markings on Four-or-More
Lane, Two-Way Roadways
page.normal_text:
Not in 1988 MUTCD.
Not in 1988 MUTCD.

The center line markings on undivided two-way roadways with four or more traffic lanes, shall be the two- direction no-passing zone marking.
The center line
markings on undivided
two-way roadways with
four or more traffic
lanes, shall be the two-
direction no-passing
zone marking.
